body: This is the tracking issue for releasing M25.

comment_data.body: When run in Android Studio (3.1), the Project view opens with the `Android` filter applied, and no Dart files are visible. You have to switch over to the `Project` filter to see your source files (and, many users are unlikely to know to do this). Also listed here: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/2243 ; @stevemessick, we should address this soonest.
In Android Studio, I don't see `File > Project Structure` (and no similar action in the toolbar), but I do see the `Open Module Settings` from the context menu.
After selecting the `Ffutter > Open module in Android Studio` menu, I see a gradle upgrade message:

@stevemessick, I'm not able to get the new `Flutter commands` editor command bar to show up. I'm opening Java files from within the android/ directory of a Flutter project (filed https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/2291).
It's not possible to disable the --track-widget-creation flag now (I'll look at this). (edit: this has been fixed)

@devoncarew In 3.2 the Project Structure menu item is not visible unless a project system is defined. For Flutter that is implemented by FlutterProjectSystem. Not sure why it would be an issue for 3.1. Has there been a new 3.1 release that possibly added that API?

> In 3.2 the Project Structure menu item is not visible unless a project system is defined. For Flutter that is implemented by FlutterProjectSystem. Not sure why it would be an issue for 3.1

Hey - I'm not 100% sure this _is_ an issue, but was going through our smoke test script, noticed that the Project Structure menu item wasn't visible in some places, and mentioned it here. Sounds like - in 3.1 - this is expected.

One thing we need to work on for 3.2 is a really good Project Structure editor. And I have a branch somewhere that starts that. But I think for 3.1 it should at least be visible from the menu. I cannot recall it not being there for 3.1, but it definitely is an issue for 3.2.

That and the missing command bar are problems that I would not expect to see in 3.1. As far as the missing command bar is concerned, that could easily be affected by non-obvious changes. It is very sensitive to changes in the algorithm to display the parent menu item.

IIRC I adde that item to the test script to give us early warning to API changes. Perhaps it is working as intended :)

Sorry, I don't have easy access to the full code base. i can take a look after returning to the office next week.

Found this issue while testing M25 #2298 
Also got an exception when trying to create a new project in IntelliJ 2018.2 EAP, which pointed to the plugin. I filed a bug report through IntelliJ. Want one here as well?

@devoncarew sorry for the slow response.
Here it is: #2302

>  sorry for the slow response.

No, thanks much for testing on EAP :)

title: meta issue for releasing M25
